info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued December 23 at 6:50PM MST until December 23 at 7:30PM MST by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: The National Weather Service in Great Falls has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northern Judith Basin County in central Montana... Northwestern Fergus County in central Montana... Southeastern Hill County in north central Montana... Central Chouteau County in north central Montana... Northeastern Cascade County in central Montana... * Until 730 PM MST. * At 648 PM MST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Big Sandy to 9 miles southwest of Fort Benton to 9 miles south of Belt, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Fort Benton, Big Sandy, Stanford, Belt, Geraldine, Denton, Parker School, Agency, St. Pierre, Geyser, Highwood, Raynesford, Rocky Boy, Sluice Boxes State Park, Shonkin, Loma, Coffee Creek, Armington, Square Butte and Iliad. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.
